Package shadowGame

Class Bullet

  • java.lang.Object
    • shadowGame.Bullet
  • public class Bullet
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a Bullet class, it is meant to control the creation of bullets
    Since:
    20th December 2018
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Daniel Adesina

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double getX()
      a method to get x
      double getY()
      a method to return y
      void setX​(double x)
      a method to set the x value of the portal
      void setY​(double y)
      a method to set the y value of the portal
      void update()
      This is the update method, it is the backbone of all the classes in this game Modelled after the natural sprite update loop in pygame, it updates the animation, and collision checking of the bullet

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bullet

        public Bullet​(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
              javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas,
              Level level,
              double x,
              double y,
              boolean direction)
        This is a constructor for the Bullet Class, it passes it multiple values.
        Parameters:
        gc - This is for the GraphicsContext to allow drawing on the canvas
        canvas - This is the canvas, and FXML object that is linked to the .fxml file as an ID for the canvas
        level - This is the level, this is where everything is drawn and the centralDx is decided
        x - A double for the x point
        y - A double for y point
        direction - a boolean for direction

      • Bullet

        public Bullet​(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
              javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas,
              double x,
              double y,
              boolean direction,
              java.lang.String name,
              double dx)
        This is a constructor for the Bullet Class, it passes it multiple values.
        Parameters:
        gc - This is for the GraphicsContext to allow drawing on the canvas
        canvas - This is the canvas, and FXML object that is linked to the .fxml file as an ID for the canvas
        x - A double for the x point
        y - A double for y point
        direction - a boolean for direction
        name - A string value to open up the corresponding image, rather than preset animation frames

        public void update()
